title: 2 suspects arrested in Rosemary Anderson school shooting, 1 still sought
content:
PORTLAND, Ore. -- A second suspect has been arrested in connection to Friday's Rosemary Anderson High School shooting.
Portland Police Bureau Gang Enforcement Team detectives arrested 18-year-old Marquel Dugas and booked him into the Multnomah County Jail on a probation violation.
Dugas is believed to be the second of three young men involved in the shooting Friday outside the alternative school in northeast Portland.
Lonzo Murphy, 22, was also arrested Saturday in connection to Friday's shooting.
Murphy was taken into custody just after 1:30 a.m. Saturday by Gang Enforcement Team officers after stopping his car at North Interstate Avenue and Going Street.
A handgun was found in the vehicle at the time of his arrest.
The Special Emergency Reaction Team served a search warrant at an apartment on North Killingsworth Street as part of the investigation. The apartment is five blocks from the school shooting scene.
Murphy has been booked into the Multnomah County Jail on a charge for parole violation and additional charges are pending.
Shooting victim Taylor Michelle Zimmers, 16, has been upgraded to fair condition from serious. David Jackson-Liday, 20, has been upgraded to good condition, and 17-year-old Labraye Franklin was released from the hospital on Saturday.
